channel.title: NASA Armstrong Flight Research Center News and Features
channel.description: News and Features from NASA's Armstrong Flight Research Center

item.title: NASA Armstrong Completes F/A-18E Tests
item.description: Understanding what stress, or strain, an aircraft can endure is critical to carrying out its intended mission.
item.source: NASA Armstrong Flight Research Center News and Features

item.title: Smooth Rides Ahead for Advanced Air Mobility Aircraft
item.description: Airline passengers today expect a smooth ride with little turbulence. While turbulence can’t always be avoided, aircraft design considerations and designs limit what the passenger feels.
item.source: NASA Armstrong Flight Research Center News and Features

item.title: NASA Armstrong Develops Tech to Bring Space Launch to Any Airport
item.description: A NASA-developed space launch system is attracting interest from companies that need to launch satellites in orbit. This same launch system could also develop high-flying, ultra-fast aircraft for national defense.
item.source: NASA Armstrong Flight Research Center News and Features

item.title: NASA MIRO Program Provides STEM Career Path
item.description: Dionne Hernandez-Lugo always wanted to work for NASA, but did not know how to get started on her career path.
item.source: NASA Armstrong Flight Research Center News and Features

item.title: NASA’s X-57 Maxwell Powers Up
item.description: NASA’s X-57 Maxwell all electric aircraft reached another milestone toward its first flight with the successful installation of two 400-pound lithium-ion battery packs in the cabin of the plane.
item.source: NASA Armstrong Flight Research Center News and Features

item.title: NASA Poised to Break Sound Barrier in New Way
item.description: Now, aeronautical innovators with NASA’s Quesst mission are poised to break the sound barrier again, only this time in a very different way that could make it possible for all of us to one day travel by air just as fast as any of the X-1 pilots who flew supersonic.
item.source: NASA Armstrong Flight Research Center News and Features

item.title: NASA Awards Contract for Facilities Operations, Maintenance Service
item.description: NASA has selected TBP & JJ Worldwide Services of Leesburg, Virginia, to provide facilities operations and maintenance service for the agency’s Armstrong Flight Research Center in Edwards, California.
item.source: NASA Armstrong Flight Research Center News and Features

item.title: NASA’s S-MODE Field Campaign Deploys to the Pacific Ocean
item.description: The mission’s fleet of ship, aircraft, and marine robotics will study ocean eddies and other elusive features near the surface that have a big influence on climate.
item.source: NASA Armstrong Flight Research Center News and Features

item.title: NASA MIRO: 30 Years of Providing Research Opportunities
item.description: NASA MIRO: 30 Years of Providing Research Opportunities
item.source: NASA Armstrong Flight Research Center News and Features

item.title: NASA’s Upgraded Mobile Mission Control Center to Analyze Advanced Air Mobility Flight Tests
item.description: NASA recently unveiled a series of upgrades to its Mobile Operations Facility (MOF), a specially outfitted mission control center on wheels housed at NASA’s Armstrong Flight Research Center in Edwards, California. NASA’s Advanced Air Mobility
item.source: NASA Armstrong Flight Research Center News and Features
